intro: Koeleria scheuchzeri, commonly known as the Alpine Koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, blue to purple florets. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Koeleria scheuchzeri is often found in mountain meadows and is a hardy species that can withstand harsh climatic conditions.
